q: The one negative on the night for Chris Bosh was the crowd of 18569 at the Air Canada Centre, which ended a streak of nine consecutive sellouts. Donald Rumsfeld 's retrospective reinforces earlier accounts of a dysfunctional National Security Council riven by tensions between the Pentagon and State Department. Addressing charges that he failed to provide enough troops in Iraq, he allows that, In retrospect, there may have been times when more troops could have helped. But he insists senior military officers never informed him if they had reservations about the size of the invading force.

the collapse of such a dictatorship was "inevitable" in Egypt, as well as in other countries throughout the world. "What comes next, it's hard to predict," Patrick Leahy said. A huge part of( Egypt's) natural product is tourism. They've got to get tourists feeling free to go back. Nobody's about to book a trip to Egypt right now. "The United States really needs stability there, Patrick Leahy continued, "because of our interests in Israel and Jordan and elsewhere." Sen. Bernie Sanders , I-Vt., had a similar response and called on the United States to support a transition to democracy.
